subject: How to blend meritocracy and DEI
body:
April 1st foolery; new EEOC guidance; the impact on veterans; Morgan Stanley DEI backfires  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
View in browser
 
 April 01, 2025
In a shocking reversal, the White House today announced that it is restarting DEI initiatives across all government agencies, restoring funding to all universities, and offering tax breaks to any corporation that shows tangible progress on DEI. 
April Fools'!
 … unfortunately 😭 
 
All jokes aside, we are excited to introduce the 
MIME
 framework, which aligns the calls for meritocracy with key DEI objectives—see below.
 
– Team Aleria 
DEI Backlash: 
Pros
 and 
Cons
Stories focused on the anti-DEI backlash, and efforts to put a stop to the nonsense!
 
Quantifying DEI
Exploring the tangible aspects of DEI and current efforts to quantify it
 
DEI Resources
Useful tools and information to support your DEI efforts
 
The Complexity of DEI
Unintended consequences and ripple effects of DEI
 
Golden Nuggets,
 Silver Linings
Unexpected bits of good news... when we can find them.
We almost never share links to podcasts, but this episode of 
The Future of Work
 is awesome: Jill Finlayson speaks with Bo Young Lee, who brings a wealth of experience to discuss some of the hottest topics about the DEI backlash. On the academic front, 
Harvard will offer free tuition
 to families making less than $200K/year—joining a few other elite schools in diversity push. And our unique work keeps attracting attention: check out the 
latest podcast
 and some quotes in 
CSO magazine
.
 
 
Aleria Happenings
The latest from the Aleria Team
 
Introducing 
MIME
: the Measurable approach to Meritocracy for 
ALL
 Employees
Organizations are searching for ways to comply with the administration's executive orders and the call to “restore meritocracy." But how do you create a truly merit-based system that benefits
 all
 employees? Aleria's 
Measuring Inclusion and Merit for Efficiency
 (
MIME
) 
framework provides the answer.
 
Anchored in the 
MIME
 framework, our 
Inclusive Leadership
 and 
Inclusive Management Training
 
programs give your teams the knowledge, data, tools, and best practices to foster a high-performing, stable workforce—without guesswork, backlash, or legal exposure. 
Our training is fully customizable, from half-day sessions to multi-day deep dives, both in-person and virtually. 
With 
MIME
, you don't just talk about meritocracy—you implement it effectively in a way that benefits 
all
 employees!
 
 
Visit our website
 for additional information, 
send us an email
 to learn more, or use the button below to schedule a call with Aleria's Founder and Chief Scientist, Paolo Gaudiano, who can provide 
more details and answer any questions about how 
Measuring Inclusion and Merit for Efficiency
 can give your organization a competitive advantage.
Book a call with Paolo
 
Mark Your Calendars
DEI-related events, applications and opportunities. Submit relevant events to 
info@aleria.tech
On April 3, 2025 at 12pm US/ET, join Charter and Understood for 
Neurodiversity and the Future of Business
, a discussion of the workplace designs, team dynamics, and leadership approaches to maximize the strengths of neurodivergent workers. The presentation includes case studies and resources that you can use in your own organization. 
Free registration
.
On April 3-9, 2025, join the 17th 
Annual ReelAbilities Film Festival: New York
. This amazing festival, which spans multiple venues and virtual showings, reframes disability and celebrates inclusion and accessibility through film. 
Get your tickets today
!
On April 9, 2025 at 12pm US/ET, join a Fairgodboss webinar on 
Allyship and Self-Advocacy for Career Growth
, featuring leaders from Cargill, who will discuss self-advocacy and allyship. Gain practical strategies to communicate effectively, boost confidence, challenge workplace biases, and foster an inclusive environment for career growth and support. 
Free registration
.
On April 10 at 11:00 am US/ET join our Chief Scientist Paolo Gaudiano for a FREE webinar on 
Rethinking DEI: Addressing Common Misconceptions. 
Paolo we'll dive into the misconceptions surrounding diversity and inclusion, address concerns about meritocracy, and explore practical ways to approach DEI while staying compliant with current policies. 
Free Registration
.
On April 21-24, 2025, The Winters Group will host 
The Power of Inclusion Summit
, a virtual conference designed to support the community during these challenging. There is a Pay What You Can option that lets you pay between $100 and $798 for the April 22-24 sessions. 
Learn more and register.
 
Spread the love!

If you received this newsletter from a loving friend or colleague :-), use the button below to reach our newsletter subscription page.

subject: 🌟 What is the Thirty Under 30 Program & Why Should You Be a Part of It?
body:
Submit your application before April 11!
View this email online
 
Hey Dustin,
 
Have you ever dreamed of joining an exclusive group of rising stars in the learning and development world? 
Thirty Under 30
 
is 
that
 group—an exceptional circle of innovators, trailblazers, and change-makers under 30, all recognized for their impactful contributions to the field. I
t’s
 happening right here at the
 
Learning Leadership Conference
 this October 1-3 in Orlando, FL.
What is the Thirty Under 30 Program?
It’s
 a prestigious recognition program that celebrates the brightest young leaders who are shaping the future of learning, training, and development. Being part of 
Thirty 
Under 30 means you are officially among the best in the industry, and we are here to support you every step of the way.
 
Start My Application
Applicants must have been born Oct. 4, 
1995,
 or later and be under age 30 at the Learning Leadership Conference.
Benefits of Participating in Thirty Under 30:
Networking
: Meet and connect with an exclusive group of like-minded, forward-thinking professionals.
 
Mentorship Opportunities
: Gain direct access to some of the top thought leaders and experts in the field.
 
Increased Visibility
: Receive recognition across the industry and be 
showcased
 at the Learning Leadership Conference—the perfect platform to elevate your profile.
 
Career Boost
: Your achievements will be celebrated, providing you with opportunities for new projects, collaborations, and career advancements.
 
Exclusive Resources
: Get access to tools, 
online 
events, and industry insights that are unavailable to the 
general public
.
 
If 
you're
 passionate about transforming the learning landscape and ready to be recognized for your achievements, this is the opportunity 
you've
 been waiting for.
.. OR do you know someone 
who
 is a rising star in your organization? Encourage them to apply!
 
Apply today
 to join the next generation of groundbreaking leaders in L&D!
 
Don’t
 wait, applications are only open until 
April 11 at 
11:59 P.M.
 local time.
 
Apply Now
Best, 
The Learning Leadership Conference Team
“
I absolutely loved the program and am so excited others get the chance to experience the same."
—
Leonie Yijink, MCI

CSM Learning, LLC

subject: - Why do I do what I do?
body:
Spoiler: It's corny. And authentic.‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­
 
 
A little context about some big news...
Way, way back in high school when I got the “What do you want to be when you grow up?” question, I recall answering, “I don’t know yet but farther down the road I could see myself teaching.” All I really knew was that I wanted to make a difference in people’s lives. And a positive one at that.
 
I knew classroom teaching wasn’t my sweet spot, but I dabbled in it on three continents before I found my way to transformational training and facilitation for adults, and a few years later when I became MBTI and coaching certification Sparks of Change was born. I’ve long known I am not the one to lead the movement, but my role is to support and spark, if you will, others to be and do their best. And, in the past two years a new identity emerged as I became a trauma-informed coach and healer, developing myself into a somatic and spiritual leader.
As coach, facilitator, trainer, instructional designer and healer—my role is to help people get along just a little better. Corny factor acknowledged, this is my bit towards world peace. 
Psst:
­
Read the gory details of my journey summarized in pithy bullet points.
­
About Me
 
Last summer I started itching to figure out how to communicate the common thread to my roles and skills.  
Thus, with help from the amazing folks at 
Perspektiiv
, 
I am thrilled to launch the new Sparks of Change website!
­
Check it out now! 
 
­
I facilitate connection
 to yourself, to others and with Spirit.  
I take a holistic and inclusive approach to wellness, experiential learning and facilitation for individuals and groups interested in transformation and wellbeing. 
Promo code: CONNECTION
To celebrate and be of service to those who know me and those will be new,  I am gifting everyone a deep discount to come work with me. 
 
Use code CONNECTION for a 25% discount on any offering. Must be purchased by April 15, 2025 but you can schedule sessions for any time, they won't expire.
 
This is heart work, I offer a money back guarantee if you are not satisfied. 
 
Let's Connect Now
­
I would love to support and learn along with you, 
 
Joayne Nicole 
­
Sparks of Change
4509 Oakland Ave, 55407, Minneapolis

subject: Rethinking the Language of DEI
body:
Bridging Divides Without Compromising Values  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
View in browser
 
 March 18, 2025
DEI has become undoubtedly one of the most polarized topics in today's workplace. While some attribute the backlash to misinformation, what if the real issue is how we—DEI advocates—have framed and communicated these concepts? Our team has recently written about this challenge, not to assign blame but to foster understanding. How did we get here, and how can we do better? Whether you champion DEI initiatives or have doubts, we invite you to read, listen, and share your perspective.
 
 
– Team Aleria
DEI Backlash: 
Pros
 and 
Cons
Stories focused on the anti-DEI backlash, and efforts to put a stop to the nonsense!
 
Quantifying DEI
Exploring the tangible aspects of DEI and current efforts to quantify it
 
DEI Resources
Useful tools and information to support your DEI efforts
 
The Complexity of DEI
Unintended consequences and ripple effects of DEI
 
Golden Nuggets,
 Silver Linings
Unexpected bits of good news... when we can find them.
Congratulations to Louis Chesney, whose consulting work on the film 
Magnetospher
 has contributed to its selection as one of fourteen feature films to be screened at the 
ReelAbilities Film Festival New York
—the world's largest festival dedicated to showcasing films that celebrate the stories and talents of people with disabilities.
We're also pleased to see 
female influencers bridging the gap 
between traditional media in a male-dominated sport and a growing online fan base of women. And, of course, kudos to the 
nine companies leading the way
 with policies that break down barriers to workforce participation—and are seeing the results!
 
 
Aleria Happenings
The latest from the Aleria Team
Missed these conversations? Listen here:
🎙️
The Chris Voss Show Podcast
: 
“Measuring Inclusion: Higher profits and happier people, without guesswork or backlash”
🎙️
The State of Work Today Podcast
: 
"
The Real Business Case for Inclusion: Measuring What Matters"
🎙️
The Future Talent Council interview
: 
“Measuring What Matters: A New Approach to DEI"
 — a written version of the interview is 
also available, download it 
here
.
 
Embrace a new approach to DEI! Find out how focusing on inclusion leads to greater, sustainable diversity while driving superior performance for 
any
 organization, creating alignment instead of backlash. 
Visit our website
 for additional information, 
send us an email
 to learn more, or use the button below to schedule a call with Aleria's Founder and Chief Scientist, Paolo Gaudiano, who can provide more details and answer any questions about how measuring inclusion can give your organization a competitive advantage.
Book a call with Paolo
 
 
Mark Your Calendars
DEI-related events, applications and opportunities. Submit relevant events to 
info@aleria.tech
On March 27, 2025 at 11am US/ET, join this expert-led session, where leaders from KPMG, Legal & General Investment Management, and Lloyds will share proven strategies for creating workplaces that celebrate neurodiversity - driving innovation, boosting productivity, and cultivating a culture of belonging. 
Free registration
.
On April 3, 2025 at 12pm US/ET, join Charter and Understood for "Neurodiversity and the Future of Business," a discussion of the workplace designs, team dynamics, and leadership approaches to maximize the strengths of neurodivergent workers. The presentation includes case studies and resources that you can use in your own organization. 
Free registration
.
On April 3-9, 2025, join the 17th Annual ReelAbilities Film Festival: New York. This amazing festival, which spans multiple venues and virtual showings, reframes disability and celebrates inclusion and accessibility through film. 
Get your tickets today
!
On Thursday, April 10 at 11:00 am US/ET join our Chief Scientist Paolo Gaudiano for a FREE webinar on 
Rethinking DEI: Addressing Common Misconceptions. 
Paolo we'll dive into the misconceptions surrounding diversity and inclusion, address concerns about meritocracy, and explore practical ways to approach DEI while staying compliant with current policies. 
Free Registration
.

*Offer applies to the cost of TurboTax Full Service (“Full Service”) for 2024 personal taxes filed in calendar year 2025 and no other services. To be eligible to participate in the Beat the Price Program (“Program”), customer must: (i) Have used a Certified Public Accountant or other licensed tax preparer to prepare, sign and file their 2023 personal tax return (including through Full Service and TurboTax Verified Pros but excluding TurboTax Full Service Business); (2) Sign-up for or sign-into TurboTax Full Service and lock in their discount by March 18, 2025; and (3) File 2024 personal taxes with Full Service by March 25, 2025, 11:59 PM ET. Program is available only to legal US residents. 
Price will be calculated at the time of 2024 tax return filing based on customer’s actual 2023 tax return prep fees minus 10%, or TurboTax’s current forms-based pricing, whichever is lowest, as determined by Sponsor in its sole discretion. The price difference will be adjusted at time of tax filing unless Sponsor requests proof of last year’s payment. 
To receive this offer, customer must provide an eligible receipt for 2023 personal taxes (“Eligible Receipt”) upon TurboTax’s request. The Eligible Receipt must be a valid receipt as determined by TurboTax in its sole discretion. If customer does not provide an Eligible Receipt, customer will not be entitled to any discount or an alternative Full Service offer. In such event, customer may be prohibited from using Full Service to file customer’s 2024 taxes and may be transferred to another TurboTax service, as determined by TurboTax in its sole discretion. 
Price includes 1 federal filing and applicable state filings via Full Service; other products or services are not included. Excludes TurboTax Full Service Business, TurboTax Verified Pro and TurboTax Canada services. Offer not available in combination with any other TurboTax offers and not valid for use with TurboTax self-preparation offerings. TurboTax reserves the right to modify or terminate this offer at any time for any reason in its sole discretion.

body:
Hi Dustin,
Please see below - final approval for Delmonte COC.
**Please note they stressed that all SCORM wrappers be completed. You had said it would take 2-3 days to complete, so 
can you reconfirm that you can get this all done by EOD Friday?
I had a call with Diligent today, and they have mentioned some slowdowns in delivery & also not all work updates being done. (I know we discussed this, so this isn't a complaint - just letting you know that they are not the happiest with us right now). So, I just want to make sure we deliver this 100% for them - without any mistakes.
Thank you!

Hello Randi,
Thank you for your patience.
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
<image.png>
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,

Hi Catalina,
 
Ok, if any availability pops up today, please let me know and I will make that time work. But in the meantime, sent over an invite for Friday.
 
Here is a summary of the situation:
Del Monte noted earlier this week that the SCORM 2004 test file worked well in their LMS but followed up asking if we could send them their test report.
We informed them that without explicit access to their LMS and metadata, it would not be possible to generate a report on their behalf.
They replied that their LMS does not allow for any reports to be exported. This is where the misunderstanding occurred.
Earlier in the project, it was interpreted that they were not getting the desired information from SCORM 1.2 completion reports. That is why we decided to proceed with SCORM 2004 as it allows for customized reportage.
We have asked Del Monte to confirm with their LMS, Convercent, what type of reports or metadata can be generated or exported. Awaiting a response here.
Questions to discuss:
Is there any way to run a report on behalf of Del Monte?
Have reporting capabilities been brought up in the prior year updates for Del Monte? If so, what was the recommendation?
Thanks!

subject: Exciting News: Learning 2025’s Thirty Under 30 Program is Now Accepting Applications!
body:
It's time to submit your application!
View this email online
 
Hey Dustin, 
We're thrilled about the upcoming 
Learning Leadership Conference
 
is n
ow officially a
ccepting applications
 through 
April 11
! This prestigious program recognizes and celebrates the
 
brightest
 young innovators
 in the 
learning and development industr
y
. 
If you are impacting L&D, we encourage you to apply!
 
Why Apply? 
Being part of the 
Thirty Under 30 cohort
 is an experience 
that brings unmatched opportunities for growth, recognition, and networking. Here are just a few of the many benefits of joining the program:
 
Apply For The Thirty Under 30 Cohort Today!
• Gain access to a network of like-minded peers, seasoned professionals, and industry leaders who can help propel your career and initiatives. Also, receive invites to special events at Learning 2025, where you can showcase your work and connect with some of the most influential voices in the industry. 
• Get recognized as a top innovator in the L&D community, elevating your personal and professional brand. 
• Open doors to new opportunities with exposure to influence organizations, decision-makers, and potential mentors. In addition, participate in tailored development experiences designed to help you grow as a leader. 
Submit an Application
This program is competitive and highly selective, with only 30 rising stars chosen each year. 
Applicants must have been born Oct. 4, 
1995,
 or later and be under age 30 at the Learning Leadership Conference.
 
If you fit the bill, now is the time to 
submit your application.
 Not eligible? Encourage an outstanding colleague to apply! Don't wait, applications close 
April 11
 at 11:59 PM.
Best, 
The Learning Leadership Conference Team
“
The Thirty Under 30 program was a great opportunity for me, and I know that those in my alumni class have been able to progress in their careers since being part of the program."
—
Sarah Truchard

CSM Learning, LLC
. All Rights Reserved.

and

.

. If you would like to unsubscribe from our emails,

subject: Find amazing talent with industry-leading casting tools
body:
Dustin ★ Find Cast & Crew for all of your productions - Get a 25% discount - Plus, casting advice and a platform overview ★
 
 
Post a Job for 25% off
  
with casting code: 
AMAZING73
 
 
Backstage reaches over 3 million actors, performers, 
and creative professionals worldwide. We are the 
most-
trusted casting resource, helping creators 
find 
the 
right talent
 for their projects for over 50 years.
Start the Casting Process 
With These Industry-Leading Tools:
 
Talent Database
Use advanced filters to find just the right talent worldwide. Or post a job for instantaneous distribution of your casting call.
 
Casting Dashboard
Easily keep track of your productions, notes, team collaborators, and talent applications.
 
Messaging
 Communicate with talent individually or in bulk. Messages are automatically organized by project.
 
Collaboration
Team collaboration tools allow you to share talent profiles with your clients and colleagues.
 
Audition Scheduling
Create your own audition schedule. Manually or automatically populate the schedule with candidates. Easily keep track of who's available to attend and who needs to reschedule.
 
Self-Taping
Send a self-tape audition request to your favorite applicants. The talent will then create a custom audio or video recording for your review.
 
Voiceover Platform
When you call for voiceover artists on Backstage, you get access to all of our usual great casting tools + access to specialized voiceover talent profiles and search tools based on a range of voiceover skills and voice characteristics.
 
Virtual Auditions
Cast talent online in real-time without the need for a physical location. Virtual auditions are fully integrated with the audition scheduling system. And you'll automatically get a video recording of your live video-conference audition.
 
Talent Invitations
Once you've posted a job, you'll begin receiving applications from Backstage's vast talent network. Additionally, you can proactively find more candidates in the Talent Database and easily invite them to apply.
 
Application Manager & Shortlists
Every project gets its own Application Manager, where you can quickly filter down to the best candidates and organize submissions into convenient workflow folders. Then place your favorites into Shortlists to easily share your selects.
Are you ready to get started?
 
Find Talent
Creator Advice
Post a Job
Thank you
 
VP of Casting

*Offer applies to the cost of TurboTax Full Service (“Full Service”) for 2024 personal taxes filed in calendar year 2025 and no other services. To be eligible to participate in the Beat the Price Program (“Program”), customer must: (i) Have used a Certified Public Accountant or other licensed tax preparer to prepare, sign and file their 2023personal tax return (including through Full Service and TurboTax Verified Pros but excluding TurboTax Full Service Business); (2) Sign-up for or sign-into TurboTax Full Service and lock in their discount by March 18, 2025; and (3) File 2024 personal taxes with Full Service by March 25, 2025, 11:59 PM ET. Program is available only to legal US residents. 
Price will be calculated at the time of 2024 tax return filing based on customer’s actual 2023 tax return prep fees minus 10%, or TurboTax’s current forms-based pricing, whichever is lowest, as determined by Sponsor in its sole discretion. The price difference will be adjusted at time of tax filing unless Sponsor requests proof of last year’s payment. 
To receive this offer, customer must provide an eligible receipt for 2023 personal taxes (“Eligible Receipt”) upon TurboTax’s request. The Eligible Receipt must be a valid receipt as determined by TurboTax in its sole discretion. If customer does not provide an Eligible Receipt, customer will not be entitled to any discount or an alternative Full Service offer. In such event, customer may be prohibited from using Full Service to file customer’s 2024 taxes and may be transferred to another TurboTax service, as determined by TurboTax in its sole discretion. 
Price includes 1 federal filing and applicable state filings via Full Service; other products or services are not included. Excludes TurboTax Full Service Business, TurboTax Verified Pro and TurboTax Canada services. Offer not available in combination with any other TurboTax offers and not valid for use with TurboTax self-preparation offerings. TurboTax reserves the right to modify or terminate this offer at any time for any reason in its sole discretion.

subject: Microlearning SCORM issue
body:
Hello Patricia & Dustin,
I hope all is well with you! I'm emailing you regarding two of our SCORM packages: 
- Managing Unconscious Bias in Performance Reviews
- Managing Unconscious Bias in Hiring
We are failing to upload these SCORMs properly and are getting this error message: Failed - There is a file in each zip which appears to be too long
We believe this might be due to some assets within the SCORMs that have very long names such as GL_LDSP_MUBPRFCRW: languages/PortugueseB/scormcontent/assets/businessman-in-formal-clothes-is-with-black-man-ou-2023-11-27-05-03-29-utc.jpg
Would it be possible to shorten the lengths of the names of these assets (and ensure this doesn't "break" any of the functionality within the course) and reshare the SCORMs?
Please let me know if you have any questions. Thank you!
-- 
Al Morali
he/him
Senior Instructional Designer
Colgate-Palmolive Company
909 River Road, Piscataway, NJ US 08855

subject: EL Pricing & New Build request
body:
Hi again 🙂.
Thank you again for your time and help working with me & LCW!
I took these notes from our call re: pricing for EL builds & added some of my own thoughts:
Tier 1
: $1,500-$2,000 for the first one - then after the first couple we can get it down in price (perhaps $800-$1,000). (this is assuming a series; example: LCW asks Dustin to do 5 Spotlights; after doing the first one, future ones would be quicker to build because we would have a template in place)
Tier 2
: $2,000-$5,000
Tier 3
: $5,000-$8,000 can cover 
most
 levels of complexity...branching, etc.
Tier 4:
 $8k+ - very time intensive builds 
Languages
: About 3 hours per lang  (roughly $200 per) - Could do tiers like we do with clients (Ex: Tier 1 - Spanish, French, etc. is $120; Tier 2 is $180; Tier 3 is $200)
We should create a 
description of each Tier
 so it is clear to everyone (LCW, Elixir, Client) what is involved.
Let me know your thoughts on the above.
And last but not least, 
we do have a request for a new EL build of about 25 min from Ryan Specialty
. They want to do something very similar to what they did last time:
https://360.articulate.com/review/content/6e619a48-1167-4861-a4ec-ac8fdb349092/review
This is more about Cultural Competence (with a global approach). If we get you a PPT deck of this new course, could you 
please LMK what the price would be to build 
(based on the last EL we did for Ryan)? And also about 
how long it takes to build v1?
Most likely I would build the PPT deck with Keri's help (so we get the right design elements), and then we would pass it to you.
Lmk if you have any questions or need more info.
THANK YOU, DUSTIN!
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

subject: [Expensify] Travel and expense, at the speed of chat
body:
tl;dr - Introducing Expensify Travel: fully managed corporate travel via web, app, or chat – now available to every Expensify member
 
Travel and expense should go hand in hand… and now they can! We've long been asked by customers big and small for the ability to: 
Book flights, hotels, rail, and car rentals from inside the app.
Limit what inventory employees see to only what is in the authorized travel policy.
Pay for these bookings using a central virtual card.
Capture the travel receipts into an automatic expense report.
Cut travel costs
In 
New Expensify
, press the green + button 
> Book travel
 (or in 
Expensify Classic
, click the 
Travel
 button along the left side of the screen). It does all the things you expect (in-policy booking results, travel-based spend analysis, out-of-policy notices, approvals before booking, duty-of-care reporting), plus a few tricks you don't – courtesy of the realtime chat framework of the New Expensify superapp: 
Realtime duty of care
, which lets you know where all your employees are at all times. We even connect the traveler and travel manager in a dedicated chat room to discuss all bookings and changes the instant they happen, rather than whenever you get around to checking your inbox.
Realtime expense management,
 where every booking receipt and change fee is recorded as an expense that's submitted up through Expensify's realtime approval and next-day reimbursement engine: book today, get paid tomorrow!
Realtime collaboration
, where shared trip chat rooms are automatically created in New Expensify so that everyone is on the same page. From employees to managers, everything you need to know about your trip, all in one place. 
The instant, chat-first design of New Expensify is why we like to say that Expensify does:
Travel and expense at the speed of chat.
To check it out, open your Expensify app and click 
Travel
, or take a peek below!
It's one of the most exciting times to be at Expensify that I can ever remember. We have a 
lot
 going on, and it's energizing to be sharing it with you after so long in development. Keep an eye out for a ton more on the way!
-david
Founder and CEO of Expensify
Questions? Ask me in the 
#new-expensify-feedback
 room! 
PS: Check out OpenAI's work on building an 
artificial engineer
 to solve Expensify App open source projects!
Sent by: Expensify, Inc. - 548 Market St #61434 - San Francisco, CA 94103
To unsubscribe, please click 
here

subject: Simplify your casting process with these industry-leading tools
body:
Dustin ★ Unlock the power of Backstage for FREE. Casting you can trust, from the world's most popular casting service. ★
 
 
Simplify Your Casting Process 
With These Industry-Leading Tools:
:
 
Job Posting Network:
Easily distribute calls for cast and crew. Target exactly what type of talent you need and where you need them. Reach an audience of over 3 million aspiring performers and professionals.
 
Applicant Management System:
Talent submissions are automatically organized for you by project and role. Advanced tools allow you to quickly filter down results to the most relevant candidates; customize your workflow process; collaborate; and communicate.
 
Talent Search:
 
The Backstage Talent Database grants you access to a vast network of talent. Filter the results to find profiles that will fit even the most niche production needs, including actors, voiceover artists, dancers, singers, comedians, influencers, and more.
 
Remote Casting:
No matter where you are in the world, now you can 
cast talent online and in real-time
, with our live "virtual audition" video-conference tools and custom-recording "self-tape request" system.
Are you ready to get started?

Starting soon!
Respite & Resilience Gathering
Register Now
 
30 min session
 
Wednesday Feb 19, 4:30 pm central / 5:30 pm eastern
 
I will lead you through simple but powerful somatic tapping to ground and release current trauma including: 
* Two techniques for grounding and releasing the trauma of hypervigilance
* A daily practice to connect to your power and protect your energy
 
Your parasympathetic system will get a reset, you’ll have named and released much of what has accumulated in your body and we’ll share positive communal energy that you can take forward. 
 
Free to register
I’ll share a link for an optional sliding scale payment ($10 minimum) after we complete. 
Check out the final date
 
­ 
­ 
­ 
I hope you can join, 
 
Joayne Nicole
­
